Detailed Description

This is simply a place for storing all the Sound utilities and functions.

This is a place for loading, storing, and running sound files as necessary in a given game.

Definition at line 69 of file soundmanager.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phys::SoundManager::SoundManager ( bool  DefaultSettings = true  ) 

Class Constructor.

This is the class constructor. It gives you the option to start up the manager with default values if you choose. If not then you'll need to setup and initialize the manager yourself after it is constructed.

Parameters:
DefaultSettings Whether or not to load default settings and initialize the manager immediately.

Definition at line 155 of file soundmanager.cpp.

void phys::SoundManager::ClearLogs (  ) 

This empties logs that the audio subystem creates.

Internally the Physgame engine currently uses cAudio to process 3d sound. It has it's own logging system that we have customized to work with our logger. This clears that data allow us to work with it as we need

Definition at line 194 of file soundmanager.cpp.

Sound * phys::SoundManager::CreateSound ( String &  SoundName,
String &  FilePath,
bool  Stream 
)

Creates a sound instance from a file that can be used to play sounds.

This function will create a Sound from a file and returns a pointer to that Sound. You can also specify if you want the sound to be streamed from the disk so that it doesn't have to load the entire song from disk first.

Parameters:
SoundName The name of the Sound instance.
FilePath The path to the file AND the name of the file.
Stream Whether or not to stream the audio from the disk. Otherwise it has be completely loaded into memory before it can be used.
Returns:
Returns a pointer to the Sound Instance that was created.

Definition at line 74 of file soundmanager.cpp.

Sound * phys::SoundManager::CreateSoundFromMemory ( String &  SoundName,
const char *  Data,
int  Size,
String &  Extension 
)

Creates a sound instance from a memory buffer.

This function allows you to create a sound instance from a sound that is already loaded into memory.

Parameters:
SoundName The name of the sound instance.
Data Pointer to the char array (buffer).
Size Size of the char array (buffer).
Extension The extension of the file used to load that sound (wav, ogg).
Returns:
Returns a pointer to the Sound Instance that was created.

Internally the Physgame engine currently uses cAudio to process 3d sound. It has it's own logging system that we have customized to work with our logger.

void phys::SoundManager::Initialize (  )  [virtual]

Inherited Initializer.

Written to allow the class to compile, this currently does nothing, but could be used to run code Use InitializeManager() instead.

Implements phys::ManagerBase.

Definition at line 61 of file soundmanager.cpp.

void phys::SoundManager::InitializeManager ( String &  DeviceName,
int  OutputFrequency = -1,
int  EAXEffectSlots = 4 
)

Initializes the Manager.

This function will initialize the manager using the device and parameters provided. You need to call this function if you passed false into the sound manager constructor before you can use the manager.

Parameters:
DeviceName The name of the device you wish to have this manager interface with/use.
OutputFrequency Frequency of the output audio, -1 for the devices default.
EAXEffectSlots The number of effects per sound allowed to be applied.
